alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 7:22AM CDT until March 30 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL DOUGLAS COUNTY... At 722 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mansfield to near Ava to 17 miles northwest of Gainesville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Drury... Vanzant... Squires... Brushyknob... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
